meanings.sent1: The cake had a boozy flavor from the rum soaked in it.
meanings.sent2: The bar served boozy cocktails that were popular with the customers.
meanings.sent3: The boozy aroma of the wine filled the room, making everyone crave a sip.
meanings.sent4: The air was thick with the boozy scent of the brewery, creating a cozy atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The dessert had a rich and boozy taste that lingered on the palate.

meanings.sent1: She stumbled out of the party, looking boozy and disoriented.
meanings.sent2: The group of friends became boozy after a night of heavy drinking.
meanings.sent3: The cat knocked over a bottle of wine, getting boozy on the spilled liquid.
meanings.sent4: The city streets were filled with boozy revelers celebrating the holiday.
meanings.sent5: His speech was slurred and his movements unsteady, clearly boozy from the alcohol.
